sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Access control policy; system</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).  Systems defined as CSPs:  Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as </assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>At a minimum, the organization requires that users of information system accounts, or roles, with access to the following list of security functions or security-relevant information, use non-privileged accounts, or roles, when accessing other system functions, and if feasible, audits any use of privileged accounts, or roles, for such functions: a. Setting/modifying audit logs and auditing behavior; b. Setting/modifying boundary protection system rules; c. Configuring/modifying access authorizations (i.e., permissions, privileges); d. Setting/modifying authentication parameters; and e. Setting/modifying system configurations and parameters.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Access Control">408779fcdb211010280df36f29961977</control_family> <control_name>Non-Privileged Access for non-security Functions</control_name> <control_number>AC-06(02)</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory Enhancement</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AC-06</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>Systems defined as CSPs:  High & Moderate:  CSP.1 - For CSPs, the organization requires that users of information system accounts, or roles, with access to all security functions, use non-privileg</implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010820</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:21</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 U.S.C. ยง552a(b); FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; OMB Memo: M-06-16; 45 C.F.R. ยง164.308(a)(3)(ii)(B); 45 C.F.R. ยง164.502(b)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>PL-4</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>This control enhancement limits exposure when operating from within privileged accounts or roles. The inclusion of roles addresses situations where organizations implement access control policies such as RBAC and where a change of role provides the same degree of assurance in the change of access authorizations for both the user and all processes acting on behalf of the user as would be provided by a change between a privileged and non-privileged account.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  This control requires system users with elevated privileges to use their non-privileged accounts when performing non-security functions. Requiring system users to use their non-privileged accounts when working with PII for purposes other than security functions limits inadvertent access to or disclosure of PII and protects the integrity of PII.Any access involving PII that is non-administrative in nature should require the user to use their non-privileged accounts to perform that function.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>d087b9fcdb211010280df36f29961916</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
